trial_identification.studytitle: Hospital based physiotherapy for patients with non-small cell lung cancer during in-hospital undergoing in-hospital cytostatics treatment
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effect of hospital based physiotherapy for patients undergoing in-hospital chemotherapy for non-small cell lung cancer on physical fitness, dyspnea and quality of life

interventions.interventions: In this project, it is proposed to examine the relationship between comprehensive hospital based physiotherapy in patients with non-small-cell lung carcinoma during cytostatic treatment and its impact on physical fitness, patient endurance, health related quality of life, dyspnea and fatigue. It is believed that the results obtained during our research will emphasise the importance of physiotherapy in the treatment for oncology patients. In the research will participate 50 patients (in the researched group 25 participants and in the control group 25 participants) with stage III or IV non-small-cell lung carcinoma (NSCLC), diagnosed within the last 6 weeks, or with earlier stage of the disease, excluded from surgery or radiation), confirmed by cytology or histology test results. The research study will take place at the Independent Public Clinical Hospital No. 3 of Medical University of Silesia in Katowice. The rehabilitation group: Based on the initial 6MWT and spirometry results, subjects will participate in two, two week periods of rehabilitative exercise therapy, supervised by certified Physiotherapist. Before first 2-weeks rehabilitation program and between these two periods, patients proceed to scheduled chemotherapy in hospital condition.The control group: There will be a 6 week period between initial and final assessments; during the middle two weeks patients proceed to a scheduled chemotherapy period. Patients will participate in exercise sessions 5 times per week. Sessions consisted of: Morning exercises 1. (8:30-9:00 am) specific respiratory exercises for 30 minutes - relaxation exercises for breathing muscles, strengthening exercises the diaphragm with resistance, exercises to increase costal or chest breathing, prolonged exhalation exercise, chest percussion 2. (10:00-10:30 am) 30 minutes of fitness and respiratory exercises - coordination and balance exercises, stretching exercises using elastic bands, balls rehabilitation, sensory pillows. Performed in a standing position, kneeling, sitting, lying on side, abdomen and back. 3. (11:00-11:30 am) training on a cycle ergometer or treadmill for 20-30 minutes, intensity 30% - 80% peak work rate. Afternoon exercises 4. (1:00-1:30 pm) Resistance exercise intensity 40% - 70% 1RM, 5. (3:00-4:00 pm) Nordic walking for 45 minutes (depending on weather and health condition of the patient), 6. (4:00 pm) relaxation training - Autogenic training is a desensitation-relaxation technique developed by the German psychiatrist Johannes Heinrich Schultz. The technique involves the daily practice of sessions that last around 15 minutes. During each session, the practitioner repeats a set of visualisations that induce a state of relaxation. Each session can be practiced in a position chosen amongst a set of recommended postures (for example, lying down, sitting meditation, sitting like a rag doll). The technique can be used to alleviate many stress-induced psychosomatic disorders. Heart rate and O 2 saturation will be monitore continuously throughout sessions exercise and blood pressure was assessed intermittently.
interventions.comparator: The patients of the control group will be assesses before and after 6 weeks of chemotherapy alone.

primaryOutcome.outcome: physical fitness (endurance, fatigue) assessed using Functional Fitness Test
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 1. baseline - Initial assessment of the patient, Chemotherapy session (1 week home care) 2. 3 weeks - Assessment of the patient after rehabilitation physical fitness assessment. 3. 6 weeks - Final assessment of patient after 6 weeks including physical fitness assessment

primaryOutcome.outcome: Lung function (composite of FEV1, FVC, FEV1%FVC) assessed using spirometry
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 1. baseline - Initial assessment of the patient, 2. 3 weeks - Assessment of the patient after rehabilitation lung function assessment. 3. 6 weeks - Final assessment of patient after 6 weeks lung function assessment

primaryOutcome.outcome: dyspnea assessed using MRC, BDI, Borg Scale
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 1. baseline - Initial assessment of the patient, 2. 3 weeks - Assessment of the patient after rehabilitation dyspnea assessment. 3. 6 weeks - Final assessment of patient after 6 weeks dyspnoea assessment

secondaryOutcome.outcome: quality of life assessed using St George's Respiratory Questionnaire, SF-36, Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy - Lung (FACT-L)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 1. baseline - Initial assessment of the patient, 2. 6 weeks - Final assessment of patient after 6 weeks quality of life

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: ability to perform the 6 minute walk test, Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status 0-1 and ability to complete self-questionnaires and willingness to participate/ cooperate in the study
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: uncontrolled hypertension or unstable coronary artery disease, anaemia (HB< 10g/dl), severe osteoarthritis and bone metastases or CNS metastases.

trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation using a randomisation table created by computer software
trial_design.statisticalmethods: The number of participants of research was determined depending on the average number of patients with diagnosis NSCLC in stage III B or IV (disqualified from surgery intervention) admitted to hospital in the previous year from the start of the study. The data will be express as arithmetic mean (X) and standard deviation (SD). To investigate the difference in indication values between the measurements, the Wilcoxon Signed Ranks Test, which does not require Gaussian distribution.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: 1. The patients diagnosed in last 6 weeks with non small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) in stage III or IV ( or in early advanced stage, disqualified from operation or radiotherapy), confirmed on the basis of result from cytological examination or histopathological. Cancer staging TNM from medical records ( x-ray and CT of thorax, ultrasonography of abdominal cavity). 2. Information for the patients about aims and principle in research and written consent of participation from the patients. The aim of the study was to assess the effect of rehabilitation program conducted on fitness and exercise capacity, lung ventilatory function, quality of life and dyspnea. Additionally, possibility for rehabilitation in patients with advanced lung cancer was assessed.
